intro: Microcaelia taeniophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf microcaelia, is a small, flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
